Weâ€™ve evolved. Now weâ€”and by â€œweâ€ I especially mean my fellow punditsâ€”are semioticians. We are no longer interested in what our political candidates say, but rather in what they mean to say. The plain reading of words has given way to the esoteric interpretation of gestures, signals, symbols and intent. When Mr. Trump says things that are, on their face, nonsensical, we do not say: â€œThis makes no sense.â€ We say, â€œLetâ€™s try to make sense of it.â€ We no longer lay the blame on the communicatorâ€™s failure to communicate, but on our supposed failure to understand.
